name: misp
label: MISP
description: MISP connector allows to create MISP event, delete MISP event, add and delete attributes (IOCs), add and delete tags, into existing MISP event

fields.title: Server Name
fields.description: Specify Hostname or IP address of the MISP server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.tooltip: Specify Hostname or IP address of the MISP server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: hostname

fields.title: API Key
fields.description: Specify API key that is configured for your account for using the MISP server.
fields.tooltip: Specify API key that is configured for your account for using the MISP server.
fields.name: api_key

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description:
Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.
By default, this option is set as True.
fields.tooltip:
Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.
By default, this option is set as True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Add Event
operations.description: Creates an event and adds the new event in MISP based on the event information and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Event Information
parameters.description:
Specify brief description of the malware or event you are creating, including the internal reference for the event.
You can add a detailed description of the event by adding attributes to the event after the event is created.
parameters.name: event_info
parameters.tooltip: Specify brief description of the malware or event you are creating, including the internal reference for the event.

parameters.title: Date
parameters.name: date
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify date on which you want to create the event in MISP.
parameters.tooltip: Specify date on which you want to create the event in MISP.

parameters.title: Distribution
parameters.description:
(Optional) Setting that controls on who can view this event once it is published and eventually when it gets pulled. Apart from being able to set which users on this server are allowed to see the event, this also controls whether or not the event will be synchronized to other servers.
You can choose between Your organization only, This community only, Connected communities, or All communities.
parameters.tooltip: Specify setting that controls on who can view this event once it is published and eventually when it gets pulled. Apart from being able to set which users on this server are allowed to see the event, this also controls whether or not the event will be synchronized to other servers.
parameters.name: distribution

parameters.title: Threat Level
parameters.description:
(Optional) Indicates the risk level of the event.
You can categorize events into different threat categories, which are Low, Medium, or High. You can also alternatively leave this field as Undefined.
parameters.tooltip: Select the risk level of the event.
parameters.name: threat_level

parameters.title: Analysis Status
parameters.description:
(Optional) Specify the current stage of analysis of the event.
You can choose between Initial, Ongoing, or Completed.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the current stage of analysis of the event.
parameters.name: analysis

parameters.title: Published
parameters.description: Select this checkbox to publish the event in MISP.
parameters.name: published
parameters.tooltip: Select this checkbox to publish the event in MISP

operations.title: Get Event
operations.description: Retrieves information about an event from MISP based on the event ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: Specify ID or UUID of the event whose information you want to retrieve from MISP. You can get ID or UUID of event using Run Search action.
parameters.tooltip: Specify ID or UUID of the event whose information you want to retrieve from MISP. You can get ID or UUID of event using Run Search action.
parameters.name: event_id

operations.title: Add Attributes to Event
operations.description: Adds specified attributes to an existing MISP event based on the event ID, attribute type and value, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: Specify ID or UUID of the MISP event to which you want to add attributes. You can get ID or UUID of event using Run Search action.
parameters.tooltip: Specify ID or UUID of the MISP event to which you want to add attributes. You can get ID or UUID of event using Run Search action.
parameters.name: event_id

parameters.title: Category
parameters.description:
Specify category of the attribute that you want to add to the specific event in MISP. You can choose from options such as Internal reference, Targeting data, Antivirus detection, Payload delivery, Artifacts dropped, Payload installation, Persistence mechanism, Network activity, Payload type, Attribution, External analysis, Financial fraud, Support Tool, Social network, Person, Other.
Note:Options of Attribute Type parameter will be based on this parameter.
parameters.tooltip: Specify category of the attribute that you want to add to the specific event in MISP. Options of Attribute Type parameter will be based on this parameter.
parameters.name: category

parameters.title: Attribute Type
parameters.description: Specify the type of attribute that you want to add to the specific event in MISP.
parameters.tooltip: Choose Category parameter first. Specify the type of attribute that you want to add to the specific event in MISP.
parameters.name: type

parameters.title: Attribute Value
parameters.description: Specify the value of the attribute that you want to add to the specific event in MISP. Attribute value could be IP address, Port no, Email address, URL etc.
parameters.name: value
parameters.tooltip: Specify the value of the attribute that you want to add to the specific event in MISP. Attribute value could be IP address, Port no, Email address, URL etc.

parameters.title: Attribute Distribution
parameters.description:
(Optional) Specify the setting controls on who can view this attribute once it is published. By default, "Inherit Event" is set, which means that this field inherits the distribution that is set on its parent event.
You can choose between Your organization only, This community only, Connected communities, or All communities or Inherit Event.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the setting controls on who can view this attribute once it is published. By default, "Inherit Event" is set, which means that this field inherits the distribution that is set on its parent event.
parameters.name: distribution

parameters.title: Use Attribute as an IDS Signature
parameters.description: Select this checkbox if you want to add attributes for Intrusion Detection System (IDS) and this sets the to_IDS flag to True in MISP.
parameters.tooltip: Select this checkbox if you want to add attributes for Intrusion Detection System (IDS) and this sets the to_IDS flag to True in MISP.
parameters.name: to_ids

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify Comments that you want to add for the attributes. Comments are used for informational purposes only and not for correlations.
parameters.tooltip: Specify Comments that you want to add for the attributes. Comments are used for informational purposes only and not for correlations.
parameters.name: comment

operations.title: Delete Event
operations.description: Deletes an event from MISP based on the event ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: Specify ID or UUID of the event that you want to delete from MISP.  You can get ID or UUID of event using Run Search action.
parameters.tooltip: Specify ID or UUID of the event that you want to delete from MISP.  You can get ID or UUID of event using Run Search action.
parameters.name: event_id

operations.title: Delete Attribute from Event
operations.description: Deletes an attribute from a MISP event based on the attribute ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Attribute ID
parameters.description: Specify ID or UUID of the attribute that you want to delete from MISP. You can get attribute ID or UUID using Run Search Action.
parameters.tooltip: Specify ID or UUID of the attribute that you want to delete from MISP. You can get attribute ID or UUID using Run Search Action.
parameters.name: attribute_id

operations.title: Run Search
operations.description: Searches for events or attributes in MISP based on the input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Controller
parameters.description: Select whether you want to search for Attributes or Events in MISP.
parameters.tooltip: Select whether you want to search for Attributes or Events in MISP.
parameters.name: controller

parameters.title: Search Type
parameters.name: search_type
parameters.tooltip: Select which type of searching you want to do.
parameters.description: Select which type of searching you want to do. You can select from Basic and Advanced.

Basic.title: Search From
Basic.description: Specify the date to retrieve events after this date.
Basic.tooltip: Specify the date to retrieve events after this date.
Basic.name: from

Basic.title: Search Until
Basic.description: Specify the date to retrieve events before this date.
Basic.tooltip: Specify the date to retrieve events before this date.
Basic.name: to

Basic.title: Attribute Type
Basic.description: Specify the attribute type to retrieve attribute or related events. You can specify from md5, sha1, sha256, ip-src, ip-dst, etc. For more information refer https://www.misp-project.org/openapi/#tag/Attributes/operation/restSearchAttributes
Basic.tooltip: Specify the attribute type to retrieve related events. You can specify from md5, sha1, sha256, ip-src, ip-dst, etc
Basic.name: type

Basic.title: Page
Basic.name: page
Basic.description: Specify page number from which you want to retrieve data form MISP.
Basic.tooltip: Specify page number from which you want to retrieve data form MISP. By default it is set to 1

Basic.title: Limit
Basic.name: limit
Basic.description: Specify the maximum number of records to be retrieved from MISP.
Basic.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of records to be retrieved from MISP. By default it is set to 10.

Advanced.title: Search Filter
Advanced.description: Specify Search filter as documented at https://www.misp-project.org/openapi/#tag/Events/operation/searchEvents in JSON format. For example {"page": 0,  "limit": 1,  "searchDatefrom": "2020-01-20",  "searchDateuntil": "2020-01-20"}.
Advanced.tooltip: Specify Search filter in JSON format. For more information refer connector documentation.
Advanced.name: search_filter

operations.title: Add Tag
operations.description: Adds a tag in MISP based on the tag name and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Tag Name
parameters.description: Specify name of the tag you want to create in MISP.
parameters.tooltip: Specify name of the tag you want to create in MISP.
parameters.name: name

parameters.title: Exportable
parameters.description: Select this checkbox if you want to create an exportable tag in MISP.
parameters.name: exportable
parameters.tooltip: Select this checkbox if you want to create an exportable tag in MISP.

parameters.title: Hide Tag
parameters.description: Select this checkbox if you want to hide the created tag in MISP.
parameters.name: hide_tag
parameters.tooltip: Select this checkbox if you want to hide the created tag in MISP.

parameters.title: Organisation ID
parameters.description: Specify ID of the organization that you want to add to the tag that you are creating in MISP.
parameters.tooltip: Specify ID of the organization that you want to add to the tag that you are creating in MISP.
parameters.name: org_id

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.description: Specify ID of the user that you want to add to the tag that you are creating in MISP.
parameters.tooltip: Specify ID of the user that you want to add to the tag that you are creating in MISP.
parameters.name: user_id

operations.title: List All Tags
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all existing tags from MISP.

operations.title: Add Tag to Event
operations.description: Adds a tag to an existing event in MISP based on the tag and event ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: Specify ID or UUID of the MISP event to which you want to add the specified tag.
parameters.tooltip: Specify ID or UUID of the MISP event to which you want to add the specified tag.
parameters.name: event_id

parameters.title: Tag
parameters.description: Specify ID or name of the tag that you want to add to the specified event in MISP.
parameters.tooltip: Specify ID or name of the tag that you want to add to the specified event in MISP.
parameters.name: tag

operations.title: Remove Tag from Event
operations.description: Deletes the specified tag from an existing event in MISP based on the tag and event ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: Specify ID or UUID of the MISP event from which you want to remove the specified tag.
parameters.tooltip: Specify ID or UUID of the MISP event from which you want to remove the specified tag.
parameters.name: event_id

parameters.title: Tag
parameters.description: Specify ID or name of the tag that you want to remove to the specified event in MISP.
parameters.tooltip: Specify ID or name of the tag that you want to remove to the specified event in MISP.
parameters.name: tag

operations.title: Get Attribute Type
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all existing specific attribute type.
